channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A Dangerous Ride on Top of a Train in Mexico
item.description: The incoming Trump administration has promised sweeping deportations of undocumented people and little empathy for those seeking refuge in the U.S. Despite that, migrants continue to make the dangerous journey north through Mexico to get to the U.S. border. We hop on a freight train with some migrants to find out why.
item.content:encoded: The incoming Trump administration has promised sweeping deportations of undocumented people and little empathy for those seeking refuge in the U.S. Despite that, migrants continue to make the dangerous journey north through Mexico to get to the U.S. border. We hop on a freight train with some migrants to find out why.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: 'The birds are back.' Resilience in the ruins of the Palisades fire
item.description:
Will Rogers State Historic Park is a vast stretch of natural space in the Santa Monica Mountains. It's a treasure to Angelenos. People get married there, picnic there, and have kids' birthday parties on the great lawn.

The park's namesake, Will Rogers, was a vaudeville performer, radio and movie star, and was known as America's "cowboy philosopher."

His nearly century-old ranch house is the park's centerpiece. It's survived a near miss with wildfire before. Last week, as firestorm engulfed large parts of Los Angeles, this piece of American history was reduced to rubble.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
Will Rogers State Historic Park is a vast stretch of natural space in the Santa Monica Mountains. It's a treasure to Angelenos. People get married there, picnic there, and have kids' birthday parties on the great lawn.

The park's namesake, Will Rogers, was a vaudeville performer, radio and movie star, and was known as America's "cowboy philosopher."

His nearly century-old ranch house is the park's centerpiece. It's survived a near miss with wildfire before. Last week, as firestorm engulfed large parts of Los Angeles, this piece of American history was reduced to rubble.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)

item.title: Zyn nicotine pouches can be marketed in the U.S., the FDA says. What does this mean?
item.description: The FDA said "an extensive scientific review" found the products were found to pose lower risks of cancer and other serious health conditions compared to cigarettes and smokeless tobacco products.
item.content:encoded:
The FDA said "an extensive scientific review" found the products were found to pose lower risks of cancer and other serious health conditions compared to cigarettes and smokeless tobacco products.

(Image credit: Bebeto Matthews)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Air traffic controllers rush to divert aircraft after Elon Musk's rocket explodes
item.description: Debris streaking across the Caribbean appeared to cause confusion and delays.
item.content:encoded:
Debris streaking across the Caribbean appeared to cause confusion and delays.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: A planet parade of Venus, Saturn, Jupiter and Mars shines in the skies this month
item.description: All month, Venus, Saturn, Jupiter and Mars will appear to line up and be bright enough to see with the naked eye in the first few hours after dark. This weekend, Venus and Saturn get especially cozy.
item.content:encoded:
All month, Venus, Saturn, Jupiter and Mars will appear to line up and be bright enough to see with the naked eye in the first few hours after dark. This weekend, Venus and Saturn get especially cozy.

(Image credit: Ginnette Riquelme)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Justin Baldoni has sued Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds for $400 million
item.description: Baldoni, his studio Wayfarer, and their publicists are alleging civil extortion, defamation and a slew of contract-related claims about the film It Ends With Us.
item.content:encoded:
Baldoni, his studio Wayfarer, and their publicists are alleging civil extortion, defamation and a slew of contract-related claims about the film It Ends With Us.

(Image credit: Combination photo)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: Newly discovered poems show Virginia Woolf as a fun aunt
item.description: A researcher — who was looking for something else — stumbled onto two poems by Virginia Woolf. The silly, punny, quickly drafted poems were written for her niece and nephew sometime after March 1927.
item.content:encoded:
A researcher — who was looking for something else — stumbled onto two poems by Virginia Woolf. The silly, punny, quickly drafted poems were written for her niece and nephew sometime after March 1927.

(Image credit: George C. Beresford)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: CNN settles lawsuit after $5 million defamation verdict
item.description: CNN settled with a security consultant after a Florida jury found the network had defamed him in a story that suggested he was charging "exorbitant prices" to evacuate people from Afghanistan in 2021.
item.content:encoded:
CNN settled with a security consultant after a Florida jury found the network had defamed him in a story that suggested he was charging "exorbitant prices" to evacuate people from Afghanistan in 2021.

(Image credit: CNN via Internet Archive/Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Ohio's Lt. Gov. Jon Husted to fill U.S. Senate seat vacated by JD Vance
item.description: In making his announcement, Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine said he wanted a "workhorse" in the U.S. senate who would focus on Ohio as well as the rest of the country.
item.content:encoded:
In making his announcement, Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine said he wanted a "workhorse" in the U.S. senate who would focus on Ohio as well as the rest of the country.

(Image credit: Paul Vernon)
item.dc:creator: Karen Kasler

item.title: Immigrants drive Nebraska's economy. Trump's mass deportations pledge is a threat
item.description: Nebraska is one of the top meat producers in the U.S. It also has one of the worst labor shortages. The incoming Trump administration has promised mass deportations on an unprecedented scale. We asked Nebraskans what that could mean.
item.content:encoded:
Nebraska is one of the top meat producers in the U.S. It also has one of the worst labor shortages. The incoming Trump administration has promised mass deportations on an unprecedented scale. We asked Nebraskans what that could mean.

(Image credit: Lexi Parra)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd
